meanings.definition: A quick and simple sewing stitch.
meanings.sent1: She fixed the tear in her shirt with a whipstitch.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used a whipstitch to hem the dress.
meanings.sent3: In a hurry, she whipstitched the button back on.
meanings.sent4: The whipstitch of friendship held them together.
meanings.sent5: The whipstitch, like a tiny kiss, secured the fabric.

meanings.definition: To sew with a quick and simple stitch.
meanings.sent1: She had to whipstitch the torn seam before the event.
meanings.sent2: He whipstitches the patches on his backpack.
meanings.sent3: I'll whipstitch this quickly so we can leave on time.
meanings.sent4: She whipstitched her way through the sewing project.
meanings.sent5: The tailor whipstitched the delicate lace with precision.

meanings.definition: To join or mend quickly and with little care.
meanings.sent1: They whipstitch the pieces together without much thought.
meanings.sent2: He tends to whipstitch his work just to finish fast.
meanings.sent3: She whipstitched the pages of the book back together.
meanings.sent4: The team whipstitched the plan together at the last minute.
meanings.sent5: The repairman whipstitched the wires, hoping for the best.
